chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Pride Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: 2:41 PM Defendant Michael Pride Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Michael Pride Jr.  Attorney Thomas Binger in court for State of Wisconsin. No appearance by the Victim.  Clerk C. Pflug.  Defendant requests restitution set at zero.  Court recommends to set restitution at zero.  State to prepare the order and submit to Judge Rossell.
Restitution hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
As to Count 1 only
As to Count 4 only
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Schwarz.  Clerk. M.Burke. On count 4 court imposes 1 year in the county jail; credit for 212 days served. Costs imposed to be paid during the term of probation. On count 1 court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions consecutive to count 4. DE to submit DNA sample at pay $450 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court. Victim requested restitution to the PSI writer but not the state. Court states Commissioner Pfeuffer will schedule a restitution hearing with 60 days from Sentencing and send notices.
of DNA Collection at Conviction

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Schwarz.  Clerk. M.Burke. On states motion counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. DE pleads guilty to counts 1 and 4. Court finds DE guilty of counts 1 and 4. PSI ordered. DNA ordered. SEH set to 09/07/22 at 1:30.
NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Schwarz.  Clerk. M.Burke. PLEAS set to 07/14/22 at 8:30.
